title: Statkraft should phase out trading unit – former minister
subtitle: (Montel) Norway’s government should order state-owned utility Statkraft to phase out its trading unit, former finance minister Trygve Slagsvold Vedum said over the weekend, following reports that key staff had been paid substantial bonuses.
body:
“The minister of trade and industry should say that the trading activities in Statkraft should be phased out. It is not desirable,” Vedum told news agency NTB.
“The main purpose [of Statkraft] must be to produce clean and stable energy for the Norwegian population,” said Vedum, who leads the Centre party that withdrew from the coalition government following a disagreement about energy policies in January. “The Norwegian state should not be a large power trader and extract large profits from fluctuating electricity prices.”
Daily newspaper Dagens Naeringsliv reported on Friday that four of Statkraft’s Germany-based traders together earned NOK 226m (EUR 19.3m) in 2023.
Statkraft told NTB that it had changed its bonus policy from 2023 in response to the high payouts, but also said that trading helped reduce price volatility in the markets and had given Statkraft revenues it could invest in renewable generation in Norway and elsewhere.
(EUR 1 = NOK 11.68)
